results.title: Changing time (quickly)
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: We see the celebration of New Year’s Eve with fireworks in 1988, repeated exactly in 1923, in 1908, and in munitions explosions in 1812, as well as an air attack in World War II and there is no difference in the image. Meanwhile, a group of women tries to remember the words of the third stanza of Schiller’s lyrics to Beethoven’s Ode to Joy. Freeways, clocks and the solar system form categories which shape experience, while Lenin’s lying in state reminds us of the previous one we saw of Gardel. Martin Heidegger and Hannah Arendt are philosophers of the city, which is visualized as a gigantic clock. Finally, Freder in Metropolis tries to hold back the hands of the enormous clock/machine anticipating the turn of the century.

results.title: Dark cave
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Dark Cave (previously `That poured its hot breath’) is an evocation of memory and identity that takes the form of a poetic video diary. Kalin endows intimate ‘home movie’ scenes of travel and personal life with mystery and melancholy. A quote from Alfred Chester serves to destabilize the lyrical nostalgia of the rhythmic images.

results.title: Salt Creek
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: With ‘Salt Creek’, Seoungho Cho turns his hypnotic camera eye on the harsh terrain of Death Valley. Through a series of delicate formal manipulations, he folds representations of a coldly beautiful landscape into images of seething video static, water sluicing out of a tap, and a surveillance view from one office tower into another. Stephen Vitiello’s score echoes the image track in describing a gradual arc of inhospitable elegance, rhythmic grace, and decay.

results.title: Rev
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: This painterly observation of pedestrian traffic through a revolving door finds a counterpoint in the flickering of a candle flame. As separate lives are blurred with the energy of constant movement, individuals merge into an abstracted urban sound and light space.
results.description: This painterly observation of pedestrian traffic through a revolving door finds a counterpoint in the flickering of a candle flame. As separate lives are blurred with the energy of constant movement, individuals merge into an abstracted urban sound and light space.

results.title: What's the name of that place you come from nan?
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Rita Hinekauia Morrison
results.brief_description: Rita comes from a mixed cultural background but her strongest connection is with the Maori side of her family. She shares her memories and family history in this digital story so that her Maori heritage can be preserved through future generations.

results.title: A Place called Gapuwiyak
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Nicole La Gerche

results.title: Where is my story?
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Julian Silverman

results.title: ASHE: the way of life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Colin Colger
results.brief_description: After the death of his mother and losing his way to a life of crime, Colin, a sports loving Shepparton boy, was offered a new beginning - a lifeline - through ASHE (Academy of Health Sports and Education).

results.title: Baby girl
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chrissy Ponting
results.brief_description: Life is very challenging for Chrissy as a teenage mum but through her love for daughter Lakeisha combined with the support of family and friends, she has been able to complete her school studies and begin training as a nurse. This is dedicated to her baby girl.
results.description: Life is very challenging for Chrissy as a teenage mum but through her love for daughter Lakeisha combined with the support of family and friends, she has been able to complete her school studies and begin training as a nurse. This is dedicated to her baby girl.
